result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul I Champlin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $15,017.34. Restitution is held open for sixty (60) days, subject to defendant's right to challenge within 30 days thereafter. Restitution is joint and several with co-actor Marios N. Shahollari.
---------------------------------------

Pay court costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
---------------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
---------------------------------------

Obtain and maintain full time employment/education or a combination of the two equaling not less than 40 hours per week. 
---------------------------------------

No contact with victims.  No alcohol.  No drugs except with a valid prescription.  No drug paraphernalia. 
---------------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
---------------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
---------------------------------------

timeConds.notes:
Ninety (90) days in Jail WITHOUT work release privileges followed by nine (9) months in Jail WITH work release privileges.  -----------------------------------
**06/17/2016 CORRECTION:  The JOC has been corrected to reflect that the Defendant is to serve **Six (6) months** in the WCJ WITH WORK RELEASE immediately following the 90 days that he is to serve WITHOUT WORK RELEASE.

records.descr: Pet for judgment for unpaid fine/forf/other

records.addlTxt: Probation extended for 18 months from 4/28/18. New discharge date of 10/28/19.

8:49 am Defendant Paul I Champlin appeared, ADA Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent Xiong appears.  Restitution set at time of sentencing was approximately $15,017 - now owes $9241.32 in restitution.  DOC is in support of discharge as they believe he is making good faith effort.  He is employed - manages rental properties for Airbnb.  He just started the job last year.  Total earnings for 2016 was about $16,000.  Earns $1300 per month before taxes...works about 35 hours a week.  He makes monthly payments of about $100 to $200 and he has been consistent.  He asks about restitution being joint and several?  And his Agent has told him that he owes more restitution on his end.  Atty Donohoo has clarified with the Agent as to payments that have been made by co-actor.  Argument by Atty Donohoo in support of an extension of probation.  She argues he has been making payments less than his ability to pay.  State is requesting 18 month extension of probation.  Mr. Champlain is not currently married but soon will be.  He lives with a roommate currently.  Defendant responds to Court's questions regarding his income and expenses.  Court extends probation for 18 months.  Deft needs to continue to make R & T payments and to increase those amounts now that he has a steady income.  9:00 am  Court in recess.
Probation review hearing on April 17, 2018 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: In Court file

2:42 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Haley Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft Paul I Champlin in court with Atty Rebecca Hammock.  
Matter is before the Court for sentencing.  Court has reviewed the PSI as well as the Defendant's sentencing Memorandum.  
Atty Hammock has reviewed the PSI with her client and there are no corrections.  
Also present are victim Brandon Downs as well as his mother, Pamela Brotzman.  
Atty Hammock recites terms of the agreement.  
Discussion concerning restitution and how long it should be held open.
2:46 pm  Statement by victim's mother, Pam Brotzman, on behalf of her son.  
Court has colloquy with the victim and his mother concerning the plea agreement.  
Mr. Downs is not in total agreement with the proposal by the parties but would rather this be done with today so he is able to move on.  
2:50 pm  Atty Rea makes further record regarding the agreement reached. 
2:52 pm  Response by Atty Hammock.  
2:53 pm  Court makes record with regard to the Agent's recommendation set forth in the PSI
2:53 pm  Statement by Deft.  
2:55 pm  Court makes record and proceeds with sentencing the Defendant.  
2:59 pm  Court in recess.

Withheld sentence - 2 years probation
JAIL TIME:  Ninety (90) days in Jail WITHOUT work release followed by Nine (9) months in Jail WITH WORK RELEASE
No alcohol.  No drugs except with a valid prescription.  No drug paraphernalia.  No weapons.  No contact with victims.  
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.  
Other counseling as may be recommended by Agent.  
Obtain and maintain full time employment / education or a combination of the two equaling not less than 40 hours per week. 
Pay court costs and DOC supervision fees.
Pay Restitution in the amount of $15,017.34.  Restitution is held open for sixty (60) days, subject to the Defendant's right to challenge within 30 days thereafter.  Restitution is joint and several with co-actor Marios N. Shahollari.  
One (1) day dead time credit if revoked
2:59 pm  Court in recess.
**06/17/2016 - Minutes corrected as to Conditional Jail time:  Deft is to serve Ninety (90) days in Jail WITHOUT work release followed by SIX (6) months in Jail WITH WORK RELEASE.  The temporary commitment submitted to the WCJ at the time of sentencing did correctly reflect the 6 months and not the 9 months.  (df)

Defendant Paul I Champlin in court, in custody with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea entered. Trial reserved. Motion deadline 10-01-15. Minutes Filed.  Status conference scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

Defendant Paul I Champlin in court, in custody with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court in session @ 2:26 p.m. Appearances made. 
State calls Detective William Becker who is duly sworn and responds to direct exam of ADA Powell. Exhibit #1 marked and identified as copy of criminal complaint. State moves complaint into evidence. Objection as to lack of foundation. Court instructs ADA Powell to lay a better foundation. Witness responds to ADA Powell's questions. Witness responds to Court's questions. Attorney Hammock renews her objection to receipt of Exhibit 1. Court receives exhibit into evidence.
2:30 p.m. - Cross exam by Attorney Hammock
2:32 p.m. - Redirect by ADA Powell
Witness excused - evidence closed.
2:33 p.m. - Argument by Attorney Hammock
2:34 p.m. - Argument by ADA Powell
Court finds that probable cause exists that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.
Minutes filed.  Arraignment scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant Paul I Champlin in court with attorney R. Hammock .  Tracy L. McMiller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes Filed.

Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH B.S.D., K.J.S., K.T.T., B.A.S., T.M.K., A.C.S. DOB 09/20/2011.   Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH M.N.S.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant in court in custody with Atty Hammock and Mr. Malkus. Atty Rea and Intern A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes Filed.
